intro: Mandevilla scutifolia, commonly known as the shieldleaf mandevilla, is a tropical vine native to South America. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are dark green with a distinctive shield-like pattern on the underside. The plant produces clusters of tubular, fragrant flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming from spring to fall. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-draining soil and plenty of sunlight. Mandevilla scutifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and vigorous growth habit.
